title: Gateway to Jolly buoy and red skin islands
review_text: Wandoor beach is at an hours drive from Port Blair. This is the place from were one can get a ferry to visit jolly buoy and red skin island. The beach is clean however one cannot go to the water as there is a risk of crocodile attack. Only visit if you plan to go to Jolly buoy island.

title: Emrald Green Water
review_text: This beach was relatively untouched by regular tourists, as it is a little far flung from the main town. Also, it has a crocodile scare plus swimming in here is not allowed. On the whole a positive and calming experience at this Wandoor Beach. I loved this beach.

title: Sunset at Wandoor beach
review_text: Visited wandoor beach with family to see sun set on 8/2/19. Fortunately there were no clouds. Sun set was really memorable experience.

title: Good beach with a dangerous reputation
review_text: Wandoor beach is one of the better beaches close to Port Blair.However the recent death of a local worker due to a crocodile attack has kept most tourista away.Check with local travel agents whether it is safe to visit.

title: Beach
review_text: Its a nice beach at portblair, very clean. Scenic place but u cannot take bath as it is not allowed due to crocodile fear.

title: There are strong currents on the beaches
review_text: There are strong currents on the beaches here and everyone is not allowed in the beaches. Many coral reefs can also be found here. Part of the Wandoor national park, Red Skin and Jolly Buoy islands boast a stunning array of over 50 varieties of coral and fish.

title: Not worth an hrs drive from Port blair
review_text: The beach is OK. But you cant get into waters as its crocodile infested. the far corner of the beach is fine to spend an hr in the evening. And this place is full of locals coming for some rituals or picnic. Overall its not worth an hrs driver from Port blair.

title: Nice clam and clean beach !
review_text: its a Nice, clam and clean beach ! entering water is not allowed due to crocodiles existence. Visit if you have enough time else you can skip and visit other beaches.

title: Crocodile Alert
review_text: If you are planning to visit Wandoor Beach which is located in outskirts of Port Blair (approx. 20 kms ) please avoid going in water. A young boy lost his life as he was killed by a crocodile. The authorities of Andaman have put up a warning board mentioning the dates when the crocodiles have appeared near the shores. The beach is beautiful & not the commercialized one and you will find more village crowd around with some shop setups selling T-shirts, shell items, local chaats and of course coconut water.

title: Good clean beach
review_text: This beach is very clean. There is also safety board here because of crocodile. Water is very clean. Surrounding is also very beautiful.

title: Only reason is Jolly Buoy.
review_text: Absolutely crappy food + no location to visit. Perhaps crocodile incidents in past laid curse on this place. Come here only if you have to go to Jolly Buoy

title: Very clean and good for photography
review_text: Good place for photography. Locals warned me of crocs, so be careful about venturing into water especially if it is raining....................

title: BEACH TIME
review_text: the beach is famous for its crystal clear water beach and the famous sunset point . the famous tourist destination

title: Mesmerized by crimson!
review_text:
One can watch a 1000 shades of crimson before the sun disappears!! Be patient ...it's an amazing trip on a auto through some of the interiors of around PB and through 

And yeah, be watchful of crocodiles.

title: Nice place
review_text: This place is called the crocodile beach. Going inside the water is prohibited as salt water crocodiles are present in the area. You can take a stroll. Watch the sunset and wet your feet on the shores. There are no changing rooms there and restroom is pretty bad even for guys. Hence only for relaxing this beach would do good. You can take a stroll and by the beach side you will get a resort named sea princess where you can have some food with a view of the beach.

title: A decent beach
review_text: There are a lots of fallen trees on the beach which adds unique charm to the beach. These trees are the remnants of destruction caused during tsunami. Sea is very calm, almost with no tide. Crocodile is an another threat at the beach although beach is decently longer and curvy in size and shape. The real beauty of the beach can be enjoyed when one move 200mts right of the market place. Visitors most often gather near the parking area, hence misses the best part of the beach. Marketing is cheaper but we have seen most people avoid marketting here. This beach is much much better then Cidiya Tapu and Munda Pahar beach located at same distance from Aberdeen bazar. More

title: 2018 annual vacation
review_text: not worth a long drive since the beach is closed beyond few feets due to crocodile scare 2 years back... do not go is my recommendation

title: Not so great
review_text: We need to go to Wandoor Jetty to catch ferry to Jolly Buoy or Red Skin island. Wnadoor beach is around a K.M from the jetty. Compared to other beaches, this is very ordinary. You cannot swim/ bath here. There is no water sports activity. Wandoor is 28 K.M away from Port Blair town and unless you are visiting Jolly Buoy or Red Skin island, avoid going to Wandoor only to see the beach.

title: A nice place But not extraordinary
review_text: This is where you take a boat ride to Jolly Buoy Island and all of us went there . The best part is -- nice , and clean and well managed . super excellent behavior by the people whom one interacts . The beach is quite good but pales in front of Radhanagar beach . for us ( all senior citizens ) it was a place worth visiting

title: Beautiful Blue Waters and Gorgeous Sand
review_text: Wandoor Beach is about 40 mins away from Port Blair, the road is good but has a few rough patches. The first thing you see when you enter the beach is the blue and pristine water. There have been instances of the crocodile being around the place so swimming is not allowed. I was told by the local police that in the first quarter of 2018 an European was eaten by a crocodile and hence the restriction in the water. However, my personal experience is that this should not deter you as the beach water is too good to miss on a trip there. Just go and relax have a beer along or take Fresh Coconut water. I Just took an isolated patch of sand far from tourists and laid there for 2 hours for relaxation. Must see beach. More

title: Wow``Amazing wandoor
review_text:
First time to travel by cruise ship to andaman, before only read on books about andaman. 
Its a fantastic places to be in having many attractions one of them is wandoor. Frm Airport bus goes there bit far away. We make you travel from villages and many houses in between. Have beautiful land surrounded. 
Wandoor is amazing place clean and clear water, you will see tides waves ups and down. Rock claiming around. They have small and motor boats to take you around. Good shops to eat on and super clean sand to play football Valley Ball. I have seen many people were doing there school and college picnic. 
My visit was long back ago 2008. Now hope it's completely changed with new structure around. 
People of the place were awesome very coordinating and supportive. 
I enjoyed my Day tour at Wandoor. 
Big hug n thanks to dear buddies who organised this trip, all school mates. Even the food was prepared from my home. Thanks to Mother too. 
ThankYou. Will plan surely sooner. More

title: Dangerous place to go into waters
review_text:
Wandoor Beach is a lovely beach but after Tsunami of Dec 2004, many crocodiles escaped from Port Blair zoo and got into waters around several beaches and there is a risk to enter waters around most of these lovely beaches. 

This beach also witnessed massive destruction and uprooting of trees, which can be seen even today. However, photographers will love this place, which has variety of birds.

title: Very Small beach.
review_text: There is no point in visiting this beach. As you it is not allowed you to go in to the water of beach due to alligator alert. Beach is not maintained at all.

title: Nothing special
review_text: You can relax yourself and does not have any sports activity. swimming is not allowed and you cant go into the water.

title: The Shopping Beach of Portblair
review_text: I got chance to explore this beach when I didn't got booking in Jetty for Jolly Buoy Island. We went to this beach . As this beach is far from the town so you need to have a plan to visit this place. Apart from natural beauty of the beach what I found here is , if you have 2-3 hours of time you can do a very good shopping. There are lots of shops which had variety articles and show pieces. We did our maximum shopping from here and found these shops to be even cheaper than the government shop. Apart from shopping there are good snacks options here. You may get Narial paani atleast in 5-6 colours. The colour of Lemon Tea and Normal Tea are different from the tea that you get in the market or home. This will attract you to have it to examine the taste. If the weather is cool you can easily spent 3-4 hours here. The shopkeepers and food sellers are very courteous . I would again advise to consider this place for Andman shopping. The shopkeeper even bargains upto 30%. More

title: Wonderful view,Small beach,Can not go to the sea because of Crocodile alert
review_text:
Wandoor beach is around 25 km east from Port Blair.If you have extra time you can visit Wandoor beach,half day tour is enough. There is Crocodile alert,so you can not go far,even can not go to water.Picturesque place,plenty of oppurtunity for photography. No food facility available. 
You go by bus or hire a taxi to there.

title: Good place
review_text: One has to go to Wandoor jetty to take boat ride for Jolly buoy island. Also, on the way Kala Pani museum is best place to visit. Mahatma Gandhi Marine Museum is just near the jetty. Worth visiting.

title: Best beach
review_text: As soon as we landed at Andaman this was first location we visited. And its so so so mesmerizing. Being an North Indian i have never seen such blue water and this view of the beach just gasped me. I would love to go back to this place again. But yeah they didn't allowed us to go in water because of crocodiles.

review_text:

But there were warning signs about crocodile attacks.

Regardless a beautiful beach

title: Beautiful
review_text: Wandoor beach is also situated in the capital town Port Blair, the beach is very beautiful and you can chill out and spend a good time here. Not many more activities are available but you can spend some hours sitting on the beach.

title: More a transit point for Jolly Buoy
review_text: This is a small beach just off the jetty for Jolly Beach. The surroundings is pristine though the beach is pretty ordinary. There is a Marine Interpretation Centre nearby.

title: Small Clean Beach
review_text: The Wandoor beach is a small nice clean beach which is located at the Wandoor ferry point from where one has to catch the ferry to Jolly Buoy island. The beach is quiet clean and one can wade safely in the waters.

title: Nice beach
review_text: Worthwhile place to visit. The beach here is nice, but you are not allowed to go in the water. They have put up a fence too. There are crocodiles here that may come out any time. Last year it had dragged a person and his body was found 3 days later. Nice breeze here at any time of the day. There are a couple of fallen trees here on which you can sit and watch the ocean. Dont forget to have a kulfi which watching!!

title: clean and peaceful beach
review_text: Beautiful view...we visited in the afternoon..less crowed...nice experience.a must visit in Portblair

title: Calm Sea Beach
review_text: We stayed @ Sea Princess Resort....lavish & maintained property. The property is old but still do-able. Had a pleasant stay.

title: Gateway for Jolly Buoy Island
review_text: Good beach where you to go for catching boat to Jolly Buoy Island some times also for Ross and North Bay Islands.

title: Beautiful beach
review_text: This is one of the beautiful beach to visit. This is 34km from Port Blair. This is good to take picture. This beach is not good for bath.

review_text:
Beautiful beach but as its a Crocodile Sanctuary crocodile sighting in common, No one is allowed to go near to the water. A safe swimming zone is constructed by A&N Administration which has spoiled the beauty of beach. And A&N Administration neither allow any one to enter into the water nor to the safe swimming zone.

title: Visit if time permits

title: Long calm and tranquil beach
review_text: While returning from Jolly Buoy Island one can visit this beach which is really serene. Its just the place to sit and relax and look into the sea...Good one

title: Nice and clean beach
review_text: The beach is well maintained. Due to crocodile sightings it was prohibited to enter the water during our visit. The water is very shallow and you can easily go 60-70 metres from the beach into the water. There are no food stalls for lunch, so you should carry your lunch in case you want to relax during the afternoon and take a siesta on the beach. It is a good beach for relaxing.

title: Lovely Beach
review_text: We visited Wandoor beach only for couple of hours in the afternoon as place was closed early due to fear of crocodile. The whole family loved the beach. It was very clean. Though we were not allowed to go to the water, we were all tempted as the beach was clean and beautiful. You can take photos during sunset from a nearby place. A long sandy beach ideal for playing games. We played for whole two hours on sand only as could not enter water; still enjoyed our stay. Worth a visit if you have time.

title: Nice clean quiet beach
review_text: Its accessible on road from port blair. One can start from port blair and visit wandoor as well as chiriyatapu on same day. There is a small tea stall on beach and few shacks selling jewelry made out of shells. Swimming is prohibited duwe to presence of crocodiles.

title: Wonderful beach but not access to water
review_text: Its a very beautiful and clean beach, not much crowded, also around 26 km from city centre. But unfortunately no access to water as recently in november crocodile attacked one boy so they put the net surrounded the beach.

title: Clean stretch of a beautiful beatch - but not much to do, thanks to crocs
review_text:
The beach is awesome clean and you can have a great view of the sunset. 
Unfortunately, no one is allowed in the waters because of crocodile scare. 

So there is not much to do here - except relax in shade and play in sand! 

Plenty of small restaurants and shops nearby if you get hungry.

title: A wonderful afternoon with families
review_text: Wandoor Beach is a lovely place to spend some time. It is about an hour's drive from Port Blair. The beach is clean, quiet and very scenic. One can walk a long stretch along the shore. There are a few shops around and a small hut where you can have a drink of fresh coconut water. The toilets, however, were not very clean. The beach is ideal for photography and will appeal to nature lovers. In view of crocodile alert warnings, tourists were not allowed to go into the water or swim - however, we had a lovely time as a family relaxing on the beach and enjoying the natural beauty of the spot. More

title: Not a great deal to do here
review_text:
This wasn't great, beach was quite dirty and sea wasn't very clean either. The area for tourists is very small and very crowded. 
Scooba Diving isn't really that, it is snorkeling whilst bending top half of your body into the sea 
I'd say try and get to another island for a better beach experience 
There is plenty of food and drink available to pass the time

title: beautiful beach
review_text: this is a beautiful beach with good views ans some trees on beach were so nice to see.some stalls are there for shopping.

title: Awesome Beach!!!!!!
review_text: One of the awesome beach in Portblair.You cannot miss this place. When I visited with my family, we enjoyed a lot. Good beautiful environment.Never ever miss this place.

title: Pleasant surprise
review_text: Lovely beach with lapping waves. Beautiful vista of outlying islands ideal for watching sunset. Unfortunately beware of crocs at the moment so no swimming. Decent hotel/bar Along the beach.

title: nice
review_text: Nice, but very crowded and fenced due to potential crocodile attacks. Good spot for beach walking and sun set.

title: One of the finest beach at Andaman
review_text: Thanks to my local friend Raj who suggested me to have visit to Wandoor beach, otherwise I could have missed such a wonderful beach view just 30 mints drive from Port Blair. Having seen Radhanagar beach at Havelock, I can say Wandoor is worth visiting for it's crystal clear blue water and a serene environment altogether. I could see a resort also to stay here. This beach is ideal for honeymoon couples. One big warning.. It's not safe to take bath here as crocodile attack happened here on recent time as the sea is connected with backwater.

title: Nice beach and small shopping centre.
review_text: Shopping is cheaper can bargain. Beware of crocodile they are man eaters. You will find the police to protect the traveller.

title: "Going Into Water Prohibitted..."
review_text: Its near the Jetty from where you catch ferry to Jolly Boy...So can be clubbed with jolly boy trip...There was a crocodile attack recently so going into the water was prohibited while I went there... Please check before you go...

title: Lonely Beach
review_text: November-2017, it is little away from the jetty point of Jollybuoy. It is comparatively lonely and found little crowd but it is net & clean. Few days back, one crocodile was caught in this area so some barricading has been done and the police picket also found.The area looked very attractive and open, you can pass some nice time there. One small shopping center and marine interpretation center also found.Not a bad experience at all.

title: Mahesh
review_text:
Transport: buses available from Aberdeen bazar bus stand ; but it is better to travel in private tourist vehicle ; as missing last bus at 6 pm from wandoor beach can be bad experience as no other mode of transport is available after 6 pm from beach 
Distance: 30 KM's from Aberdeen bus stand 
Best time: sun set 4:30 pm 
Journey: app one and half hr journey through thick forest/mangroves/marshy land/sunami waters: depart in private tourist vehicle at about 3 pm and take small break to take photographs of mangroves/marshy lands and enjoy the ride of forest 
Scene: one can see red skin island from the beach 
Swimming in beach: as per guidelines of life guards/security staff 
Sunset: mismarising colours of water 30 mts after sunset ;beautiful golden sand at sunset and mismarising view of red skin island More

title: Great beach for swimming
review_text: This is a beach ideal for swimming. It does not have waves at all. It is big great and beautiful swimming pool..must visit

title: Wandoor Beach
review_text: Wandoor is a small village near the southern tip of South Andaman. It has some beaches and a couple of accommodation options and is a nice place to relax, but it is more known as the gateway to the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park.

title: Beautiful sunset
review_text:
Peaceful beach 
Limited crowd 
Sunset is beautiful 
Safe for swimming as net is tied in swimming zone 
Far off from portblair ( 30km) 
If you have an extra half day available, pls make a visit 
Basic snacks available at the site. 
Suggest to carry bedsheet and snacks to have a picnic. 
Shops available of local handicrafts. You can bargain for the best pick.

title: A Great Beach
review_text:
Another Beautiful beach , a must see beach , about 25kms from the city , you can enjoy the scenic beauty it offers , the safe swimming in the shallow water's is a must do. 

Has a few snack and soft drink outlets and well supervised by the administration.

title: Beach escapade, andaman, things to do
review_text: Wandoor is about 35-30km from port Blair city. Lots of resorts come up and spoilt the beach front. Individual beaches are with resorts. Lots of restaurants and places to do. Sunset is amazing.

title: Snorkelling to sea the wonders of the sea below : Great Experience
review_text: We were taken to a good point to snorkel. We had a good time. The sea offers a beautiful range of fishes, octopus and sea cucumbers and coral to view.

title: Beach close to Port Blair
review_text: Wandoor is one of the well developed beaches in Andaman, which is very close to Port Blair just 30-40 minutes drive from Port Blair with beautiful blue water and also have few resorts along the beach.

title: Beautiful sunset
review_text: Wandoor beach is a clean, serene beach. Fallen trees and distant mangroves are commonly seen here. We visited in the evening and enjoyed a beautiful sun set it. It was truly amazing.

title: Nice place for evening photography
review_text: Enjoy the sunset here.Click as many as photos.Not for swimming. Background becomes awesome during sunset.A must visit place

title: Art of Mother Nature
review_text: Wandoor is actually a gateway to Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. Through Wandoor jetty, ferry runs for Red Skin Island and Jolly Buoy island. Wandoor beach is a beautiful beach which the nature has crafted in an artistic way. Blue sky, white sand, crystal clear water, clean beach are the traits of beach located just 40 minutes drive from Port Blair. The beach has several fallen tree, serving as benches.

title: Serene place
review_text: There were very very few people on this beach which we visited in the evening time. It's a serene place. We waited for sun set and enjoyed the sun set views. The beach has several fallen trees. This was very unique to this beach. Besides, you get to see pollution free sea water and sea beach.

title: Nice clean beach.
review_text: A 30-40 minutes drive from Port Blair, this beach is one of those white sand blue sea beaches the Andamans are known for. Nothing much to do but enjoy the views, take a dip in the ocean(a certain area is cordoned off for this purpose and you are not allowed to take a dip elsewhere), click photos and sip sweet coconut water. There are a few shops selling small handicrafts. Changing rooms and washrooms are available but not well maintained. There are boards saying visitors to be careful as these waters are home to salt-water crocodiles. Also there are a lot of uniformed personnel on patrol to ensure the security of visitors and life-guards on duty as well. More

title: Nice location
review_text: Andaman is famous for beautiful beaches each beach has their own beauty so hard to compare i visit Wandoor beach during my Jolly bouy visit.... i love Andaman wish to visit again in my next holiday...

title: Beauty of the Beach
review_text: This is a must visit place at the Andaman. Each beach at the Andaman has its own beauty. The serenity sums it all.

title: Underdog Beach
review_text: This beach is very famous yet the wonderful spots of Port Blair undermine this place. It is the most beautiful beach in Port Blair, but if you are going to the Havelock beaches it is a different story.

title: Nice beach close to Port Blair
review_text: Well Port Blair is not the place you want to be if you want to spend your holiday in Andaman. But if you have a day there this would be the place to go. A really clean beach with good facilities around. Not hoarded by vendors and well maintained. There's that odd fear of crocodiles looming in the area, but there is an area marked off for that purpose and hence not really unsafe.

title: Entry to the 2nd largest marine park in the world
review_text: From Portblair to Wandoor there are govt. busses which start early in the morning at 5:15. And they take 45 mins to reach Wandoor. There are busses every 1 hr and apart from these there are private busses as well which are frequent. At Wandoor jetty there are restaurants. If you go straight from the marine national park you can go to Wandoor beach. The beach is nice. Apart from the national park and beach there aren’t much to see in Wandoor.

title: Nice and Clean Beach
review_text: It is a neat and very clean beach of Andaman Islands. The beach is located bit far away from the Port Blair airport, but is a place worth paying the visit if you want to enjoy in serenity. It is a place worth visit with the family, be here during evening and enjoy the picture perfect sunset. You will love it.

title: Nice Sandy Beach
review_text: Wandoor Beach is Situated in Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park, Its a nice place to visit in a day trip. Jolly Bouy and Red Skin Islands can be visit via Wandoor only.

title: wandoor beach
review_text: super clean water , swimming safe zone , life guard, police assistance , enjoyed a lot . if u are lucky you can see sea crocodile .

title: Good sunset point

title: Wandoor beach resort
review_text: Very fine , neat , clean beach of Andaman. It is located little far from Port blair. There is good security system as beach has some problems of Crocodile. We have enjoyed sunset at Wandoor beach.

title: crystal clear beach
review_text: very good beach,easy access. ample space for parking. Police and life guards patrol the beach round the clock

title: Bluish beach
review_text: This was a rare and wonderful feeling to be in this beach. Very serene environment. Scenic beauty. good to experience.

title: Not one of the best ways to spend your time in Andaman
review_text: You need to go to Wandoor only as the starting point for the boat ride to Jolly Buoy island. There is really no other reason for you to visit Wandoor beach.

title: A nice beach with crystal clear water
review_text: A beautiful small beach part of Mahatma Gandhi marine park...known for its crystal clear water...u can see the sea floor in knee deep water.... swimming only in designated zone due to strong under water currents..nice sit outs designed by the beach in the shade. Clean n very less populated..u can visit the beach after it visit to jolly buoy island...just a few minutes drive ahead from tkt counter...

title: Simply superb

Wandoor is actually pretty popular in Andaman and Nicobar.

title: Sunset
review_text: The west Wandoor beach is supposed to be good for sunset viewing. Unfortunately on the day of visit there was a cloud cover which spoilt the show. The police patrol team are particular in clearing the beach by 5 PM as the beach has seen some crocodile sightings .

title: its is clean and beautiful beech

title: Best beach near Port Blair!
review_text:
The best way to travel to this amazing beach on a budget is taking the government bus from the main bus station in Portblair. The ticket is worth INR 20 and the bus service runs at the interval of 1 hour. 
It's a good idea to visit this beach in the morning and walk towards one end of the beach. It isn't very crowded and the water is extremely clear and beautiful. Various small islands are also visible from the beach. There are a few tea shops as well at the beach.

title: Skip this for sure
review_text: On the way back to Jolly Buoy this is a place. Nothing much to see and after visiting Jolly you would not like this.

title: Good lonely Beach to visit
review_text:

You can do shopping at beach side for local stuffs like sea pearls, sea shells etc. 

Overall good beach at lonely place.

title: Beautiful beach.......

title: Beautiful beaches

title: Splendid beach to spend a few hours
review_text: Wandoor is a wonderful beach in Port Blair. It attracts many tourists everyday during the season. The beach is located around 25 km far away from Port Blair. It is very close to Mahatma Gandhi National Marine Park which is a museum of its own kind. Wandoor beach is a broad clean sandy beach famous for its calm and glorious scenes. More over, haunting trees on the coast line, shuddered by the Tsunami creates an elegant landscape also. It takes around an hour to reach Wandoor beach from Port Blair. Hired a cab from Port Blair and took time to reach the spot about 50 minutes. The best time to visit the beach is in the morning. An excellent option for off-beat travellers is obviously wandoor beach. More

title: Nice place to visit
review_text: Nice beach point to visit and photography point as well. Water here are very clear. Must visit point for couples.

title: Beautiful long white sand beach
review_text: Must visit if you want to spend time on a long white sand beach. Small eateries are available. Must try kulfi (hawker), something to relish for mere rs 20/-.

title: Cristal clear waters delightful
review_text: A beautiful beach assessable thru chidiya tapu this is a sight so see and behold the waters here are Cristal clear and very blue . A lovely place for a visit with family

title: Clean Water, White sands, Lush greenery
review_text: beautiful place to hang out and see natural beauty. clean and well maintained place. relax and chill out in serene nature. don't forget your DSLR for amazing photography.

title: Nice beach
review_text: This is a ways from Port Blair and the drive is bumpy. Once you get there don't stop at the main dock keep driving another kilometre and there is a nice Beach. There is an area that is fenced in for swimming. The reason being there is a crocodile sanctuary further down the beach. The water is very clean and nice to either swim or to walk along the beach. Just keep your eyes open when you see the signs for the crocodiles.

title: The most beautiful beach that I have been to
review_text: I landed up on this not-so-well-known beach by chance. I went there towards late afternoon and was greeted by the most beautiful sight. The clear water, the clean beach, the fallen trees, the setting sun, it was magical. Don't stay on the main beach where most people are, just take a walk down the coastline and you will reach the most beautiful and serene views.

title: Nice place with amazing sunsets
review_text:
great beach... nice and clean 
beware of crocodiles : swim only in the protected areas (nets) 
sunsets are just terrific !

title: Still water
review_text: It is located at some distance may be 20-25 kms from the city(port blair).The cab will charge you Rs.1200/-.Go to this place either in early morning or after 3.45pm.The beach closes after 5.30PM.The unique point about this beach is that you get still water.Take clothes and take a bathe.

title: A hidden jem

title: Wandoor Beach
review_text:
Situated 25kms east of Port Blair, Wandoor beach is famous amongst tourists and locals alike. The picturesque scenery of the beach makes it ideal for swimming and coral sighting. With clean blue water contrasting beautifully against the dried trees, this beach is also equipped with neatly constructed benches and changing rooms for your convenience. The trees, uprooted during the 2006 Tsunami, make for scenic pictures. 

If you’re the adventure junkie, then a short trek to the natural caves here is just the thing for you. The caves, formed over decades, have been carved by fierce high tides that surround the beach. The challenging trek is best taken up in the morning because the tides are low and you’re able to get back by early evening. Overall, the calm and beautiful scenes of Wandoor beach are worth a visit for a soothing experience with the cave trek adding just the right amount of adrenaline. More

title: A beach with Tsunami artefacts and wonderful view

title: Well Worth it for the Journey Alone
review_text:
Wandoor is within an hour's drive from Port Blair. When I did this journey back in the 1990s the lay of the land was different in some places than it is today. After the tsunami in 2004, the sea that encroached the land still remains. You can see abandoned buildings surrounded by water and land that was once dry now permanently filled with water. 

The beach at Wandoor is small but popular with locals and tourists alike. The usual signs warning of salt water crocodiles are here as well. 

Nothing overly exciting but the journey down was interesting.

title: Beautiful Sunset
review_text:

However, there is a separate swimming area cordoned off by nets. 

There are plenty of shacks and benches. We spent the afternoon chatting as the sun went down. The journey to the beach also showed us the various areas affected by the 2002 Tsunami which erased lot of land and also created barren land where once houses and farms thrived. 

The driver we hired is called Hari and besides his taxi business, he also arranges for tours and hotels for those interested. For those interested, his contact numbers are +91 9933260982 and +919476028260. More

title: Good and long beach-- worth going
review_text:
Wandoor is quite far from the Port Blair centre (around 30 Kms). It's a good beach no doubt, but if you planning for Havelock and Neil, this can be skipped. Also try to be there during high tide, if you want to enjoy entry into water. When water recedes, it becomes rocky-- like all other beaches. 
The difference of Wandoor with other beaches is that you see lots of uprooted trees- which reminds of Tsunami. These trees are deliberately left on the beach because it reminds people of the havoc of Tsunami, makes a good landscape and also offer themselves as resting places. 
My small daughter enjoyed this place a lot as she correlated "Wandoor" with some character that she maybe watching on TV. All through, she kept fighting with this wandoor and in the process accumulated a lot of armoury in form of sticks and so. This was our last day in Andamans and we thoroughly enjoyed even after sunset. But, we were unfortunate the witness the Sunset at Wandoor. Had nice and hot tea on one of the stalls. Do visit the place if you are staying in Port Blair for 3 days or more. More

title: Calm and sweat beach.
review_text: When we reached there, it was low tide, so the sea was calm. We enjoyed and drank coconut water and pick some photos.

title: Beauty , peace and raw nature
review_text: This is the best beach of port Blair and its nearby area... Very quiet.. Peaceful... Silent beautiful sea.. So nice that it can't be explained in words

title: Ravinderjit Singh Bajwa
review_text: Best beach of portblair. Good clean and pollution free water. Although a little far from portblair at a distance of 28 km.One of the most underrated beach of portblair. Just 2km from the Wandoor jetty from where ferry to jolly buoy island starts.

title: Nothing beats this beach
review_text: We stayed close to Wandoor & this beach was just 2 kms from our resort. So we went every morning on our bicycles and it was a treat everyday. The Beach is beautiful with clear green blue waters & white white sand. The beach is sparse with people and you can actually enjoi the silence of the seas at this beach. If close to Wandoor, do do go pls

title: Wandoor could be visited only if we have a leisure day to spend at Port Blair
review_text: Nothing much great about this place. We can have nice photographs here and have a cup of locally made Hot tea!

title: nature's lap
review_text: wandoor beach is a quite natural place to spend your day. shady trees and cool sea breeze will cheer you up. beaches have swimming restrictions which worries some time. over all I say excellent picnic can be memorable.

title: Good natural scenes
review_text: It is approx 20 kms from Port Blair. You can Visit in evening for sun set. During morning you can go Jolly Buoy island from here after getting permission from govt. The beach is very beautyful but some thing different in nature. Nearly 100 m lenght only 2 foot depth in sea and crocodyle was attacked one man. Therefore bathing can not be done.

title: Serene beach with pristine waters !!
review_text:
Wandoor is a clean & pristine beach located on the Southern tip of Andaman. The beach stretches for about 2-3 km with golden sands, fallen tree trunks and small islands visible in the distant horizon. 

The Jolly Buoy Island and Red Skin Island are visible from Wandoor beach. The Jolly Buoy Island is known for clear waters with glass bottom boat rides conducted to view the corals. The boats leave very early from here and since we reached by noon we couldn’t visit these islands. 

There are small stalls for some snacks and souvenirs. 

.

title: Serene beach with clean water ...
review_text: The Wandoor beach is a beautiful beach on the southern tip of Port Blair which is close to the Mahatma Gandhi park. The beach has white sand and the water so clear that one can see live fish with naked eyes. The Sunset is fantastic too

title: Lovely Beach
review_text: Wandoor Beach in South Andaman Islands is a very quiet and quaint sea beach. The place is serene and far from din and bustle of modern urban life. A few beach resorts are available here. The most significant thing about Wandoor beach is the exquisite sunset that offers great silhouette photography. Very nice place.. worth a day's visit..Can spent a whole day here in absolute tranquility.

title: A clean and a scenic beach
review_text: I went with my family to this beach which we enjoyed a lot. The beach was clean and water was beautiful to watch. Taking a walk with family with bare foot was a beautiful experience.

title: A clean beach
review_text: I was very surprised to see a very clean water and beach and it was very quite and I was totally moved down by the place.

title: Don't go just for the beach.
review_text: The Wandoor Beach in itself does not offer much as a destination / spot. It is a 100 meter long beach (one of the shortest I've seen) and there is nothing you can actually do on the beach but look at a few fallen trees. However it is an excursion point to go to the nearby islands for snorkelling. I drove to Wandoor (25kms) and came back after sunset and was rather disappointed.

title: Nice beach
review_text: It was a very nice beach. However was very far away from the main city. The mode of transportation is mostly private vehicle. If you want to stay there then my recommendation would be se princess resort.

title: Quiet & Clean Place
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text: We went there when the season had not really picked up i.e. in early October. I liked the calm & natural enviornment of the place. For reaching that place , we passed through forest and I really liked the journey through lush Green forest.

title: Clean Beach
review_text: Wandoor Beach is one of the cleaned beach of Andaman with clear water,you must visit to this beach once and enjoy.

title: Loved the Place
review_text: Ah...I was so delighted to hire a bike and travel around alone exploring places in Port Blair. It was so exciting and experience the drive up to Wandoor Beach..cherry on cake happened when I lost my way, 3 km away from Wandoor Beach and detoured to a almost secluded beach in Wandoor. The whole experience of travelling, crystal clear water and scenery was too much for the heart. Must go..preferably on a bike with your love.

title: Wandoor beach - An ideal location for a day tour
review_text:
The beautiful Wandoor beach is situated at Mahatma Gandhi marine national park, around 30 Kms from Port Blair. The beach is an ideal location for a day tour. The drive takes about 40-50 mins from Port Blair. Nearly 15 islands are located surrounding this stretch of pristine coastline. Small ships /port charter boats start from here towards Jollybuoy and Red Skin islands. If you plan to go to Jolly Buoy or Red Skin from Wandoor beach, make sure you reach here well before 9 am as all the boats leave at 9 am for Jolly Buoy and Red Skin. 
There are some delis on the beach that offer decent eatables. Very good tender coconuts are available. Water is clean and the beach is quite for swimming. Snorkeling also takes places at the beach. The beach is also famous for corals and the glass boats that take you to Jolly Buoy and Red Skin Island let you see the corals from the magnifying glass bottom of the boats. More

title: Romantic and silent beach
review_text: the beach is isolated,cleam and not crowded.Its very underrated but excellent.The water is crystal clear and corals all around.Get your snorkling kit and wander around..

title: Location is good
review_text: On Aug 31, 2015 we made our trip to wandoor, its about close to 25 - 30 km from Port Blair by road. Please ensure you carry food items with you as there are very limited shops on the way. The beach is good to see but unfortunately we were not allowed to step into the beach as in the recent days Crocodiles are spotted over there and we were restricted to gain entry to beach. We were limited to take snaps nearby. It's considered as one of the beach under Mahatma Gandhi Marine reserve.

title: must visit
review_text: I went to the sea princess resort on this beach, where I had lunch. The beach is beautiful to walk and swim 9if you like). I enjoyed my walk

title: Good, but beware of crocodile
review_text:
Wandoor beach is good with clear water and clean and white sand. 
Sunset is awesome from here. 
Hotel sea princess having a beach side restaurant is a nice option to site and relax and enjoy the beach. 

But beware of crocodile. 
August 2015, I was there with my friends and we witnessed a terrifying incidence, a crocodile attacked a guy in the sea, but he was rescued and by the grace of god the guy was safe.

title: "Sunset view on this beach is awesome"
review_text: Wandoor beach is located in south west of port blair city and about 20 km away from the main city you may take bus frm the city or reach there by hiring a transport.Wandoor beach is beautifull silent and curvy beach you will find yourself lucky to see sunset there it gives a perfect view of sunset you wud love to see,a reputed hotel sea princess is also there on this beach its a favorite place of foreign tourists..

title: A beautiful beach
review_text: Nice beach to spend evening and morning times. Beware to sea crocodiles. Very nice beach, nice to jogging on sea shore.

title: A beautiful island
review_text: A cam and quite beach, we spend half a day in the see beach. We cannot leave the beach so nice. Waves are very low.

title: In case of raining it is terrible to go there!
review_text:
Regular Indian beach. But you can spend your time for two hours. 
Much crowded and bit dirty. Too far (30km) from city. In case of raining it will be terrible.

title: Quiet and clean West-facing beach
review_text: Great beach in a quiet corner of south Andamans. You get to see sea kraits if you go for a night walk on the beach (be careful of them though - they are poisonous!)

title: Beach
review_text: We went there through private car and that time a Red Flag was placed due to some crocodile. Rest assured we did not keep our step down and came back.

title: Wandoor is Relaxing
review_text: Nice relaxing place..Well maintained and Lovely sight... soothing to eyes and heart... Very helpful locals... Do not forget to carry Beech mat and swimming gear.

title: Must Visit Beach in Andaman
review_text: The color of water is awesome. Also the boats for Jolly Buoy Island leaves from here. Me and my friend were lucky to be there in the morning and enjoy the beach without any crowd.

title: One of the quietest beaches!
review_text: Serene and peaceful. Water was quiet and we could wade through the shallow water and got ourselves clicked a bunch of photographs on and near the fallen yet strong trees.

title: Amazing beach that never seen in my life
review_text: Nice beach with fallen trees. The water will go back in the after noon time. So you can do swim. You walk to the other side of beach to see very tall trees

title: quite nice place
review_text: very nice beaches, there were no crocodiles, but shallow water, some locals nearby but it was no problem

title: Nice beach with great Sunset view
review_text: The beach is nice and sunset view was awesome, not very croweded. nature at its best. A liitle more cleanliness will make this place more beautiful

title: Scenic Beach.
review_text:
If you love nature then you would like this beach. 

Its about 30Km from Port Blair. From the shore we were able to spot around 13~15 small islands. If wish to take bath, then this beach may not suit, however one can sit, relax and view the scenic beauty of nature.As matter of fact, we liked this beach more than Radhanagar Beach in Havlock Island.

title: One of the best Beach on this planet ...
review_text:
Wandoor Beach … Yes , it is Wandoor Beach in South Andaman of India . What a scenic beauty it is … Calm & peaceful , a paradise for book lovers if found a place there . This beach is not that much crowded as Radha Nagar Beach on Havelock Island is … 
Be here at right time ,and you will encounter the bful Sunset over here , I can’t explain the feeling of watching Sunset with Cocunut water in hand , under palm trees , with no noise at all … its amazing watching Mr Sun getting back to his home .

title: The Picturesque Wandoor!
review_text:
Wandoor Beach, a 25 km away from Port Blair is a picturesque wonder. The coral reef structures, the hide fallen tree remains of a decade long Tsunami devastation, the setting sun view with the leaves and intertwining branches of tall trees and what not. Spare time to no in the sphere of Oblivioun on the lap of Nature while on 
Andamans!

title: Calm beach
review_text: What a place to go.Enjoyed even during the hot sun.Enjoyed tender coconut also.Parking was ample.Suitable with own or rented vehicles.You can not stop taking photographs.

title: An average beach
review_text: Its a beach near wandoor jetty getaway to Jolly Buoy Island. The road ends to the beach starting point. It's an average beach . Resorts are there on right hand side of the beach.

title: Best Beach in Port Blair
review_text:
The beach is absolutely stunning and visually too good ! 
Its about 35km from Port Blair and is definitely worth going. 
You dont have many tourists visiting here and its almost like a private beach. The waters are blue and you feel like gazing at the amazing sunset !

title: Portblair
review_text: This is in Portblair. Very clean and neat beach.You can enjoy the motor sport there and food too.One can see that How people of Port Blair keep the beach clean.

title: wandoooooooorrr
review_text: this is one of the best beaches in south andaman.one the most secluded beaches during off season.the scenic beauty allows u to be in the midst of gods creation.a must visit

title: Beware of Crocodiles
review_text:
The beach is lovely but the notice board displayed by Govt regarding presence of Crocodiles give a sense of fear while entering into the sea. But I ventured into the water and spend 1 hour. The beach is a not as good as Radhanagr havelock. There are stone in the water which makes bathing difficult. 

The ambiance of beach is awesome with very few people . Total serenity and secluded.

title: Nice beach
review_text: again a nice beach (apart from chidiya tapu) to visit. Its a different experience while visiting this beach in port blair.

title: "Well maintained"
review_text:
Its bit far from port blair, well maintained jetty. its a place from where we have to move to jolly buoy island.

title: Pleasant Beach
review_text: It is one of the nice beaches near Port Blair(30km). Environment and location is so good to spend 2 hours in the evening.If we are free in the evenings At Port Blair,instead of dumbing in the hotel room, we can visit and enjoy beaches like Wandoor and Chidiya Thabu. Public transportations are available from Port Blair frequently. Pleasnt beach to walk, swim and relax.

title: good beach to relax
review_text: Beach is good nice atmosphere... evening walk is good... shallow and calm beach... small shops are available..

title: Very calm and quite beach
review_text: It's a very calm and quite beach in main south Andaman. Accessible by Bus / Taxi..Nice to spend couple of hours and relax.

title: hyped!
review_text: this is a hyped beach and a more spectacular beach would be the radhanagar beach at havelock. for portblair it is good and could visit there once. may be one could club with a visit to jolly buoy island.

title: Not very good as compared to Jolly Buoy
review_text: As we were going to Jolly Buoy, which is situated in Mahatma Gandhi Marine Park, Wandoor,We decided might as well see this beach.It is an average beach.Nothing if you compare it with Jolly buoy.Even if you skip it, it will not make a difference.

title: Average beach
review_text: This is an avarage beach near Jolly boy site.Frequented by Indian tourist.Nothing much to do .No shade in the afternoon.

title: Look great
review_text:
The water quality. surrounded scenery must to watch. 
Can take bath and spend 5-6 hr. Recommended to watch.

title: Nice place for corals lovers.
review_text: Nice place for corals lovers.Please do carry some eatable stuffs as you will not get anything apartment from tender coconut.

title: Scenic & quiet beach, lovely silver sand
review_text: Get a few pics at the serene quiet beach which is about a km from the wandoor jetty. Just beware of crocodiles, i spotted one which was bit far off though.

title: Pristine beach to yourself.
review_text: Most of the time you will have this beautiful beach to yourself as tourist are very few. The beach from the village to the headland is not very long, but an enjoyable walk. Clean sand and crystal clear water. As the tide goes out you can walk to the headland which is otherwise cut off by many fallen trees. Nice beach if you stay in this area.

title: exotic blue
review_text: Uprooted big trees lying on beach is the main attraction, we friends were busy taking photographs of us in various angle in, atop and around the uprooted or drifted trees. Very little crowd makes it calmer and enjoyable to the fullest. We carried our lunch and had it with some booze on shores, the blue colour I am not getting words to express was spectacular show. Please take safety measure before attempt of swimming.

title: Tranquil yet fascinating beach
review_text: i first visited Wandoor in August 2005, right after the tsunami. back then, it had a lot of destruction to show but the overall beauty of the beach could not be missed. as one walks further on to the southern part of the beach, one encounters a lot of shallow coves with myriad varieties of sea life teeming therein. i was able to see one of these smaller creatures squirt black ink to protect itself. all in all, it's an explorer's paradise. there's a silent rivulet also that must be crossed, which seems to harbor many a secret and many a lurking creature amongst it's thick vegetation. Back in 2005, we (my colleagues and me, about 5 of us) were standing near a shallow depression in the ground, pretty close to where the present day Sea Princess boundary wall stands taking pictures. since it was 2005, we were using a camera with a roll and after developing it the next day, what do we see! a huge crocodile, stretched out, right at our feet, apparently in deep slumber! luckily for us, it must have just fed. Seeing this photo, one of our chaps developed high fever. This is one hundred percent true. title: Best beach ever
review_text: It's absolute delight to just and watch da beach ......when I was there it's raining and that made even more beautiful.

title: Really missed it's best form
review_text:
I landed up on a rainy day and couldn't enjoy it's best form. Had really heard good about it. 

With the little options I had, the uprooted trees, b cause of Tsunami, are photo shoot points. They really so good and giving a contrasting view...wish the day was sunny..I really cursed my luck. 

The colour of the water was remarkably aqua blue...but really couldn't enjoy distant view as black clouds had blocked the visibility.

title: :: Sun Set ::
review_text: This is a long bech in length. Excellent sandy beach with excellent view of Sun Set. We had stayed at the hotel Sea Princess Beach Resort near to the beach.

title: A million shells!
review_text:
This beach is not much visited after rumours of crocodiles around, so scuba diving is not done aorund these parts, but its very picturesque. I'm not sure if any other beach in Andamans has it, but this has millions of tiny shells all along it which is quite unique. 

We did have a bit of discomfortt with a group of dogs lurking around us constantly and nipping at our heels, probably used to handouts by visitors who come here. 

Despite this, its worth a visit as its not one of the more frequented ones. Also do make it a point to hop over to Jolly Buoy - has some interesting diving and fairly clear water. More

title: Give it a pass
review_text:
As a beach, Wandoor has nothing special. 
Wandoor lies in a shallow cove, where water-level varies drastically with the tide - what is visible is a wide beach and a narrow beach. The beach is still lined with dead trees from the tsunami of 2004 - a stark reminder of nature's fury. 

The sand is smooth - almost clayey. Would do well as a mud-pack; dry yourself on the beach and then wash it off. 

There's no marine life in the waters here, not even marine plant life. 

Hutments have sprung up because of the tourism boom. A lot is available in terms of services. The natural beach did not offer so much.

title: nice and located near jolly buoy jetty
review_text: If u are visiting jolly buoy island then this is close to where one takes the transfer boat from. Like all other things in Andamans, its neat clean and worth a visit

title: Beautiful beach
review_text: It is very far from the city. We visited this beach before starting for Jolly Buoy. The boat for Jolly Buoy starts from there only. So if you are going to Jolly Buoy, then come a bit early and spend some time here.

title: Beautiful Sunset
review_text: Very far from Port Blair City, but the only proper beach in Main Island. Excellent White Beach. Best in evening hours. Negative point - need to have transport arrangement, very difficulty to find transport in evening hours

title: The only place to be in Port Blair
review_text: Awesum beach clear waters and completely natural far away from human intervention. Dont go there without your picnic basket and swimming gear.

title: Quaint peaceful beach
review_text: This is a quaint peaceful and scenic beach. Not much to do around here but you can spend a peaceful hour or so just relaxing. We got here around 10:00AM and the beach was absolutely empty.

title: Peaceful Place and good to visit
review_text: very Nice but u have to go on awkwadr time when u find peace and no crowd...plan to go in morning ..after 10 am ..people come thr so then its not worth being thr...

title: Quiet beach very clean and beautiful
review_text: you can swim in this beach. The beach is well maintained and protected by the coast guards. legends say that there are crocodiles in the beach but I did not experienced anything of that sort.

title: Nice beach
review_text: Wandoor beach is few mts away from Gandhi Marine Park. It can be clubbed with Jolly Buoy visit. There is not much to do at this beach. One can click some pics and enjoy the Sunset...

title: Not Much Worth
review_text:
We were in Andamans during Sept-Oct when HudHud was gaining strength. This place was ill maintained and nothing much was around the place. Only a dirty beach full of sea weeds. If possible better to avoid the place. 
After seeing other beaches in Havelock and Neil. this is just a normal beach.

title: Not much to do
review_text: We have stayed in the sea princess resort for couple of nights which is at the Wandoor beach. The beach is very beautiful but not much to do here.

title: Wandoor Beach
review_text: Clear waters with no waves, dried uprooted trees and shallow beach gradient makes it ideal for swimming and coral sighting. All basic amenities like changing rooms, toilets, benches and a few eateries are available. Tender coconuts are a speciality on this beach. The best time to visit is during sunset. The visit to this beach is best combined with a visit to Jolly Buoy OR Red Skin Island. Crocodiles have been sighted in the past on this beach, hence caution is advised during swimming.

title: Worth a visit
review_text: The museum at Wandoor is well maintained and ofcourse its the only way to go to Jolly Buoy. Enjoyed it thoroughly. A must-do for every tourist.

title: Good beach
review_text: It is a beautiful beach about an hour's drive from Port Blair. But it is mainly used as transit point to go to Jolley Buoy and Red Skin Islands.

title: Best Beach with Sunset view
review_text: A long drive from Port blair, on the away you can pass through couple of Villages. The beach is flat with no waves, looks like a slat water lake. The best time to visit is during evening, where you can see the sunset.

title: Sunny, Sandy and Serene!
review_text: Been here on the first day of trip, Crocodiles do exist here but we saw none. It was extremely sunny and slight breezy maybe cuz it was afternoon. But it is beautiful like all other beaches housed at andamans. We ate at nearby Sea Princess Resort restaurant and overall it was a short stay at the beach but beautiful. Don't forget to take suntan, mat to rest, umbrella , shades or hat!

title: Calm and beautiful
review_text: Its a long but easy drive from Port Blair to Wandoor Beach. The itself is not very crowded and the water is calm and clear. Very good for swimming and relaxing. Its the second best thing in Port Blair (first being Jully Bouy!!) :)

title: Exotic Beach
review_text: Excellent and must see place during your visit. Quite Far form the airport But very beautiful place with lush green natural beauty. Want to visit Again and Again.

title: Eye Pleasing!
review_text:
I have visited Andam last year with my wife and among all the beaches in Andaman, Wadoor beach is my favourite one!! Its beautiful.... the color of the ocean is absolute blue and you will get the feel of Mauritius and Thailand. The beach is very calm and scantily populated. Its a ideal destination for newly wedded couples. The scenic beauty, the calm and quite ambiance, the cool breeze and the vastness of the ocean will definitely create a magic in its self. 
Only one disadvantage : You will get tanned like anything, apply water proof sunscreen after every 5 minutes.

title: Nice
review_text: Its a nice beach also it is nearer than all other beaches as it is on the same island. U can go there by hiring two or four wheeler its nice to go by two wheeler also it is better than corbyne beach as the sea water there is clean lastly go and enjoy there....

title: Nothing very unique about it
review_text: Hey my fellow travellers...Wandoor is on Western coast of Port Blair. I took a self driven car and drove with family from Minnie Bay,where i was staying. Drive is picturesque. The beach gradient is very shallow. Sea weeds float up till the beach. Some cleaning up required before one can enjoy the beach experience. Carry your own drinking water and food if with family. Enjoy :)

title: Average place can avoid
review_text: There are much better beaches in Havelock . Wandoor beach used to be good before Tsunami . Tsunami has destroyed the beach.

title: Superb
review_text: This beach requires driving from port blair. i used a rented 2 two wheeler from aberdeen.the directions are pretty easy. The drive is just spectacular. The beach is also superb. There is good food available in the beach area. SCUBA diving is possible in the marine park.

title: Undisturbed, nice and clean beach. A bit fir though!
review_text:
This beach is very beautiful and clean. Ideal for swimming and seeing varieties of fishes. This beach is ideal for coral, shell, snail collections. You can avail the changing rooms with bathrooms. After a long swim get refreshed with a coconut water. OR there is a bar nearby the beach. For nature lovers, its an ideal place. This place should be visited while travelling towards or returning from Chidiya tapu. This beach is not as great as Havelock or Neil beaches but good in comparison with other beaches in Port Blair. 
You should visit this place if you are in Port Blair. 
Please be careful of crocodiles. You can get plenty of them here. More

title: Kind of okay
review_text: This beach is kind of okay. If you have option, probably you can go visit some other places rather than coming here. The beach is very stony and not quite favorable for taking a bath. Also I would say that you won't miss anything if you decide to skip this place.

title: beautiful beach
review_text: long beach.we can see many tall trees there.dense forest is there.We can take fine bath and it is very interesting

title: Beautiful - But very far
review_text:
We took a scooty and travelled about 40Kms from the abardeen bazaar to reach Wandoor beach. 

It is a small beach with shell pieces all over the beach. We were unable to walk in the water with the floaters and hence we have to walk bare feet. 

Also, dont forget to buy the pearls on this beach. Its the cheapest here.

title: Cool beach
review_text: Wandoor is a pristine beach can be visited while moving towards or returning back from chidiya tapu. You may get some accomodations arrangement if you want to spend some more time to engulf its beauty. Bath able beach with white sand.

title: Nice beach, even wonderful ride to the beach
review_text:
A bit far away from Port Blair, this is one beautiful beach. 
Take a couple of hours or more to enjoy the beautiful slopes and curves that lead to the beach. 

Even though me and my wife liked the beach, we liked riding to the beach even more. Greenery all around. 

Just rent a 2 wheeler from Port Blair and ride to the beach, you will love everything you see.

title: Beautiful beach
review_text:
Clean, with limited sea sports activities,spent a couple of hours, some beachside eats etc 

Sea insect bites is an irritant--please take some solution to protect

title: A gateway to the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park
review_text: Wandoor is a small village of South Andaman. It has some beaches and is a nice place to relax, but it is more known as the gateway to the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. The picturesque scenery of the beach makes it ideal for swimming and coral sighting. With clean blue water contrasting beautifully against the dried trees, this beach is also equipped with neatly constructed benches and changing rooms for your convenience.

title: best beach in Port Blair
review_text: This beach is 40 min away from the Airport with nice coconut trees and clean water. Not as great as Havelock beaches but good in comparison with other beaches in Port Blair. You can see beautiful island while swimming as islands are very close to the beach.

title: The best in Andaman trip
review_text: The place is a must visit for all the tourists. This is far away from the main city but it totally a worth visit to have a swim here. Love this place.

title: not ideal for swim
review_text: Inside the water there are rocks and is not comfortable swim. its a good view neverthless. Do visit near museum and nearby islands for a day visit

title: Disappointed
review_text: The tour to coral viewing is not at all organised. The unofficial guides try to fleece you with high prices for nothing. The arrangement for snorkeling and viewing corals are very poor an primitive. Clothes changing room is very bad.

title: Nice beach
review_text: Spent an afternoon at wandoor. The drive is brilliant and passes through places / water bodies which got created due to the tsunami. There is an uprooted tree right in the middle of the beach with roots visible. Amazing site. Crocodiles are found near this beach as per the notice however locals said that they come only during rains. Overall a must visit.

title: Clean beach but isolated
review_text:
This is one clean beach in Wandoor. An Ideal place to unwind and soak up the scenery. Calm warm water will mesmerise your body and soul. 
Good beach experience. 
No major beach shacks or restaurant. 
Isolated from main town of Port Blair (Will take about and hour) 
Sea Princess Resort is adjacent to this beach. 
Coconut and tea shops can be found at one corner.

title: A must visit....
review_text: It is such a beautiful and scenic beach that you should not miss it. It is so clean that it gives a feel of a private beach of some five star resort. There are some islands visible from this beach that adds to the scenery.

title: Fantastic, but so is every other beach in Andaman
review_text: The problem with Andaman is that every beach is so good. And thats the reason why you may plan to give it a skip provided you have been to Havelock. Actually since it is at a distance, one need to make an effort and therefore usually it gets relegated in the priority

title: Wandoor Beach
review_text: About 30 km from Port Blair . Calm and quit beach but not suitable for bathing. This is the gateway of Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park consisting of 15 islands like, Jolly Buoy, Red Skin, etc.

title: beautifull place
review_text:
I booked in April a Combo ticketby MakeMyTrip to the andaman consisting of an air ticket and a 3 day stag in Silver Sand at havelock island. Arriving in Port Blair there were for 2 days no ferry tickets available due to a ferry failure and holidays available. I informed the hotel the first evening and had to look for another hotel in Port Blair. 
MakeMyTrip nor the hotel did not even refund a part of the hotel price. Iam quite not used to such buisiness manners. 
So we finaly made our way to Wandoor beach and were estonished by the beauty of this place. 

Dr. MichaelPetermeyer

title: Pleasant and not very crowded
review_text: Wandoor beach is not a crowded place, it is almost an hour from port Blair. A cab would charge around 700 rupees from port Blair.

title: Seeing Sunset
review_text: One of the wonderful beach in Andaman. It is nearer to port blair. one can access chidiya tapu boat from this place by access ticket.

title: Small but Rocky Beach
review_text: Since we didn't get ferry tickets to Havelock and were stuck on Port Blair for another day, our hotel manager recommended Wandoor to us. With great expectations we made the 30km journey there and while on the face of it, it looks pretty gorgeous, it is a rather rocky beach. You might have to gingerly make your way in the water since you run the risk of cutting your feet on the rocks. If you are going to Havelock or any other island close by, you could think of skipping it in favor of much better beaches elsewhere

title: good beach near Jolly Buoy jetty
review_text: I spent an hour here waiting for our driver to arrange the permit and was plesently surprised to see such a beautiful beach. Got few snaps on this lovely tree which adds to the beauty of this otherwise quite beach.

title: A lovely beach
review_text: You can cover this while going to Jolly boy Island as you have o shift to ferry from here to reach the island. This place is 30Kms from Port Blair. The clear water & white sand offer a good time.

title: Calm , clean beach - close to our resort
review_text: We enjoyed the views, sunset and swimming in this beach. It was close to the resort we stayed (sea princess) . My family had a wonderful time and our kid enjoyed the beach playing and collecting shells in the safety of the resort .

title: Small beach in South Andaman
review_text: This is a small beach in remote area in south most of Port Blair. There's a bund of stray dogs which may irritate you. Otherwise beach is calm and clean. It's rocky so you can't enter the water.....Ride to Jolly Buoy/Red-skin is arnd 2kms from here...

title: Absolutely Serene and beautiful
review_text: Very beautiful beach. Clean and the coconut trees around make the beach really worth the visit. though 30 kms from city, but the road from portblair main market till wandoor is really good.

title: Good for time pass
review_text:
This beach has nice sitting arrangement to chill at the beach. Cradle is also there with many benches and tables. But no water supply in wash room and changing rooms are very dirty. 
The beach is not suitable for snorkeling and even for bath. Lots of stones are scatter all around the beach, be careful while going into water as my feet was injured here. This beach is nothing if anyone visited Havlock. All though while coming back from Joly Bouy spending the evening here can be a good experience.

title: Clean & Clear water @ Port Blair
review_text: I personally feel wandoor is the best beach at port blair. not so crowdy but best at nature's beauty.

title: Best beach in port blair
review_text:
Nice clean beach with emerald blue water. We visited the beach bit early as we had to board the catamaran to Havelock, there were hardly any people on the beach when we arrived & the view of the water & a small island (donno name) was just out of the artist's painting. Not much can be done on the beach. coconut water is available. One can easily spend about an hour or two enjoying the beauty. 
Do remember to visit the rubber & spice plantation on the way back to port blair.

title: not much
review_text: there is nothing much to do here.you can easily give it a miss...only while coming back from jolly buoy..shop if you can haggle a lot

title: Go to the caves
review_text: There are these natural caves that have form along the beach. This is a 2km walk from the beach. The trek is an experience.

title: Excellent beach!
review_text: Nice place to spend time and taking walks along the beach. The remains of the trees around the beach remind of the tsunami. The waves are less so one can walk inside the water with comfort.

title: Best beach
review_text: we liked the peace and clarity of water . we advise you to go there but beaware of salt water crocodile

title: Untouched
review_text:
Beautiful, Clear Water, Quite. Ideal for a stroll in the evening among the cool breeze and lovely sunset. 
We found a few enthusiastic dogs ready to pose for the camera :) 
Though we could not take advantage of this place because of the Cyclone Lehar that disturbed most of the natural settings. 
You won't find many shops or eateries over here. If you plan to spend more time here better pack some food and drinks.

title: good clean and unspoilt beach
review_text: Wandoor has atypical beach overlooking three islands about -2-4 kms in the sight of the beach has fully natural appeal and unparalleled view.

title: Serene, Quiet beach
review_text: This beach is very close to the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park [MGMNP]entrance. MGMNP is the place from where you need to hop on to a boat for a ride to Jolly Bouy island or Red Skin Island. The beach is neat and clean. This is a place to relax after visiting Jolly Bouy island.

title: part of visit to Jolly Buoy/Red Skin island
review_text: This place is part of visit to Jolly Buoy. After having lunch at Jolly buoy just go to this beach sit on the wooden benches take some rest, take some tea or coffee from local vendors if you wish have a look of sunset and then return.

title: good place....nice beach
review_text: Good looking place...unable to get into water as some sea dead plants all along beach due to cyclone..at that time...

title: Romantic place
review_text: Wandoor Beach is one of the best romantic place for visiting a couple the beach view and the islands in the middle of the sea is also very beautiful i recommend this place to visit when you are in portblair...

title: Best place for relaxing
review_text: Simply paradise - large white sand beach that was mainly empty when we were there. Highlight was seeing beautiful creatures and a beautiful island from the beach.
